benchmark_details.name: ShopID10K
benchmark_details.overview: ShopID10K is a dataset for generalizable object re-identification, containing 10K instances from 34 daily-life categories, featuring multi-view images and designed to evaluate cross-category generalization.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a benchmark that fosters research in scalable object re-identification systems capable of adapting to unseen categories using minimal examples.

data.source: Images collected from e-commerce platforms, particularly Amazon customer reviews.
data.annotation: Instance labels curated from product reviews

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the matching accuracy between query and gallery images.
methodology.interpretation: Higher mAP and Rank-1 reflects better identification and matching performance.
methodology.validation: Cross-validation across multiple runs and diverse datasets.
